STRATEGIC RETIREMENT PLAN

Build a confident future — today.

Strategic Retirement Plan is one of the Business Development Services (BDS) by Change Agents Cooperative Society Limited, headquartered in Mansa, Luapula Province. We provide developmental consulting and practical trainings for employees in both private and public sectors.

Talk to a Consultant Explore the Plan

Quick Facts

Head Office

Mansa, Luapula Province, Zambia

Audience

Employees in public & private institutions

Approach

Seminars • Case studies • Adult learning

Focus

Business ideation • Systems • Expansion

Need for the Strategic Retirement Plan

Across Africa—and specifically in Zambia—employees are well trained to perform their jobs, yet few are taught how to retire. While pensions may be paid, many retirees lack practical guidance on investing benefits, managing finances, and choosing viable post‑retirement businesses. Too often, people rely on trial‑and‑error or imitation.

Consequences of Unpreparedness

  • Depression and related mental health challenges.
  • Suicide cases linked to economic hardship.
  • Destitution despite education and work experience.
  • Unhealthy marriages and broken families.
  • Promiscuity by dependents to make ends meet.
  • Forced sale of critical assets (cars, houses, land).
  • Worsening conditions after asset depletion.

What Interventions Are Put in Place?

  • Identify businesses from the idea stage.
  • Start businesses and prepare bankable business plans.
  • Create systems and documentation that make businesses scalable.
  • Improve existing businesses through structured processes.
  • Expand businesses beyond geographic boundaries.
  • Deliver modular training for all the above.

Who Needs Interventions?

All employees—public and private—benefit from BDS trainings that align future businesses with personal passions. Retirement is inevitable from day one of employment; planning must be long‑term and guided by qualified business consultants.

How Will Interventions Be Delivered?

We engage employees individually and department‑by‑department to spark conversations on retirement readiness. We then run seminars that cover idea generation, selection, starting, improving, systemizing, and expanding businesses. Practical sessions use case studies and adult learning methodologies, followed by monitoring and evaluation.

Environmental Impact

Our BDS products are climate‑smart: sessions occur in small groups at hotels, lodges, or workplaces using light materials (flip charts, stationery) and projectors. We also guide clients toward climate‑smart business practices where ideas may raise environmental concerns.

Training & Services

Mindset Change

Success begins with mindset. We help communities understand and adopt winning mindsets: Growth (positive), shifting away from Fixed (negative), Poverty, and towards Millionaire mindsets.

Entrepreneurship Basics

We provide standard, practical ways of running businesses—beyond inspiration—through trainings and mentorship by our cohort of seasoned business professionals.

Interpretation of Government Policies

We connect communities to entrepreneurship‑friendly policies (e.g., CDF, CEEC loans), closing communication gaps and training on requirements and application processes.

Linkages to Policy Opportunities

We guide eligibility, due diligence, and business plan writing so communities can access available facilities and participate meaningfully in the economy.

Competitive Advantage

We excel at clear communication tailored for every audience, strong relationships, and timely delivery—serving institutions, markets, chiefdoms, villages, hospitals, and schools, with plans to expand nationwide.

Full Services List
  • Mindset change interactive lessons
  • Strategic retirement plan facilitations
  • Networking & marketing skills
  • Government policy linkages & programs
  • Exchange visits facilitation
  • Synchronization with current affairs
  • Basic entrepreneurship trainings
  • Business clinics

Change Agents Multipurpose Cooperative Society Limited

A wholly‑owned Zambian cooperative society, legally registered in Zambia. Registered on 13 January 2022 as Change Agents SEED‑A Multipurpose Cooperative Society, registration number 420220101732, TPIN 2576763740. We began as a Business Development Service provider with twelve multi‑talented business professionals. We also provide linkages between government policies and communities for programs such as CDF and CEEC.

Vision

To be Zambia’s leading service cooperative interfacing with communities to interpret government policies and enable people to benefit appropriately—shaping mindsets for success in business, advocacy, knowledge transfer, apprenticeship, collaboration, networking, and peer learning.

Objectives

  • Deliver mindset change courses in accessible languages.
  • Provide BDS to employees and entrepreneurs (retirement preparedness).
  • Explain relevant government policies so 60%+ of communities align with national plans.
  • Offer financial literacy and entrepreneurship education.
  • Coach, mentor, and apprentice entrepreneurs.
  • Build networking, marketing, and delivery skills that create self‑employment.
  • Impart self‑reliance while contributing to Zambia’s economic growth.
  • Facilitate economic knowledge application via qualified business cohorts.

Values

Professionalism • Quality engagement ethics • Social responsibility • Economic knowledge delivery • Financial literacy • Fairness • Client‑centricity • Integrity • Teamwork • Respect.

Summary Strategy – “Perfecting the Basics”

  • Best‑in‑class client service & products
  • Right people & staff development
  • Ambition, intelligence, innovation, commitment, passion, expertise, judgment
  • Incentivize communities toward development
  • Friendly, competitive learning environments
  • Sustained relationship growth with partners
  • Cost control, efficiency, lean organization
  • Optimize alliances with partners

Training Highlights

  • Chipili community (2022)
  • Mindset change focus (growth vs. fixed, poverty vs. millionaire)

About US!

A wholly owned Zambian company, limited by shares, legally registered according to The laws of Zambia.

M-TUDE INSTITUTE LIMITED is a registered business under PACRA, registration number 12080004820, TPIN: 2000778324 and was registered on 8TH JUNE, 2018 so as to do business legally in Zambia. The organization is domiciled in Luapula Province, found at Anglican Building room 4 as the head office. The founder and CEO of the company is Mr. Emmanuel Munsanje, MSc, ZICA Grad, who founded it and established it together with the other Director, Mrs. Cecilia Ngosa Chilufya as key shareholders sharing 50% each. Emmanuel Munsanje is a holder of advanced certificate in Production Management from Evelyn Hone College of Applied Arts and Commerce, Diploma in Education from Nkrumah Teachers’ College, ZICA Professional, ZICA Licentiate, ZICA Technician, ZICA Diploma in Taxation, ZICA Certificate in Taxation and a graduate member of Zambia Institute of Chartered Accountants and a practicing business consultant and also in the transport sector.

Cecilia Ngosa Chilufya is a holder of Certificate in Accountancy from the University of Zambia, Certificate in Primary School teaching from Mansa Teachers’ Training College and a holder of a Primary Degree from Mansa College of Education in association with the University of Zambia. She is a member of the Teaching Council of Zambia.

M-Tude Institute Company Ltd has been operating since 2018 providing various business trainings and consulting services to individuals and organizations and also, providing car hire services. Major aspects have been in training of cooperatives using materials translated from English to local language (Bemba). Emmanuel Munsanje, MSc, ZICA Grad is the Chief Executive Officer of the Company and he is from Teaching background with long experience in business management and requisite business qualifications. The company has worked with Plan International, ZICA, Government of Zambia through the Provincial Administration, Eunimos Investment Company Ltd and several cooperatives and SMEs mostly in the field of capacity building.

Vision

We envision a mindset changed individuals who run organizations with firm beliefs to succeed at all costs. Connecting with us will produce ‘spark plugs’ or energized communities who fight to get what they aspire to, without giving up.

Mission

Inspired to inspire

Objectives

To achieve our mission, we have challenged ourselves as follows;

⦁ Deliver mindset change courses to communities in the languages they are comfortable with.

⦁ Train business students, transmuting theories into practice.

⦁ Train people how to develop great business ideas into reality businesses.

⦁ Coach, mentor and apprentice practicing and upcoming entrepreneurs in the communities, to capacity build them.

⦁ Provide networking skills, and linking our clients to best standard achievers and best world practices in businesses.

⦁ Imparting self-reliance skills whilst inputting to individuals, for them to see and exploit diverse opportunities.

⦁ Prepare employees for retirement life.

⦁ Sharpen organizational work force to optimize production and productivity.

Values

Underlying our missions are philosophies and values of professionalism, quality engagement ethics, social responsibilities, economic knowledge delivery, financial literacy and fairness in dealing with clients and staff. In the implementation of our corporate strategy we restate commitment to the following principles.

We value our clients, who are culturally diverse. We approach every aspect of our work with the highest standards of integrity. We approach our work as a professional team. We treat each other as we wish to be treated ourselves.

Our Services

⦁ Training organizations for prolific and master class performance.

⦁ Training employees to prepare them for retirement.

⦁ Coaching and mentoring business students from certificate to masters degree levels so as to see their journey as a delight and not punishment.

⦁ Training the minds to reset for greatness.

⦁ Providing best experiences in car hire in Luapula and the surrounding provinces in Zambia.

⦁ Training households in financial literacy, budgeting and project managements at their home levels.

⦁ Offering Business Development Services (BDS) to entrepreneurs.

⦁ Entrepreneurship trainings to various community groups like churches, NGOs, employee groups and many others.

⦁ Job creation consultancy to governments around the world, through The Munsanje Job Creation Model. “ 2013”
